column4: ok I've lost my sound, I updated System76, rebooted, nothing is working. I tried going into update manager and package manager, i get this http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/55563/plain/
then I just realized I blindly followed forum posts and got the system76 driver, and I don't have a system76
so... first step IO'd like to take is removing that system76 update haha
i've been searching the forums and trying to fix this for hours
i updated Alsa and now my soundcard isn't being read at all
!killupdatemanager
anyway, so how do I get my signatures verified
another option is install htop...then find the update manager
htop?
yes, do sudo aptitude install htop
runs in command line
very nice
ok I did that... what did that do?
ahor
now type in htop
ok
did that
and search for the update manager, click f9 and kill
what does that do exactly
basically runs the same command that was told above....only sort of graphically...if you call it that
I searched and it's not there
oh wait there's "update-notifier" is that it?
